DOC.brief_title: Lactobacillus Reuteri DSM 17938 Prevention Antibiotic-associated Diarrhea Children : Protocol Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : Addition probiotic appear reduce risk antibiotic-associated diarrhea ( AAD ) . Effects probiotic strain specific , thus efficacy safety probiotic strain establish separately . We aim assess effect Lactobacillus reuteri DSM 17938 administration prevention diarrhea AAD child . Methods analysis : A total 250 child young 18 year treat antibiotic enrol double-blind , randomize placebo-controlled trial additionally receive L reuteri DSM 17938 dose 2 x 10^8 colony-forming unit identically appear placebo , orally , twice daily , entire duration antibiotic treatment . The primary outcome measure frequency diarrhea AAD . Diarrhea define accord one 3 definition : ( ) ≥3 loose watery stool per day minimum 48 hour antibiotic treatment ; ( b ) ≥3 loose watery stool per day minimum 24 hour antibiotic treatment ; ( c ) ≥2 loose watery stool per day minimum 24 hour antibiotic treatment . AAD diagnose case diarrhea , define clinically , cause C. difficile otherwise unexplained diarrhea ( i.e . negative laboratory stool test infectious agent ) .
